intro: Argocoffea afzelii, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a species native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other coffee plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and produces small, white flowers that develop into red, fleshy fruits. The fruits contain seeds that are used to make a type of coffee, though it is not as widely cultivated as other coffee species. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
